block.p: ALLEGHENY TECHNOLOGIES INC., Pittsburgh, a maker of stainless steel and other alloys, said it planned to sell two noncore businesses, Portland Forge, Portland, Ind., a producer of carbon and alloy steel parts, and Casting Services, La Porte, Ind., which produces iron castings.

WORLDCOM INC., Clinton, Miss., the second-largest long-distance phone company in the United States, said it planned to invest $140 million over the next 12 months to build 13 new data centers in Europe, to help support the Web site operating and Internet access services it would offer to European companies.

QUICK & REILLY INC., New York, which provides discount brokerage services, said it would take a 24 percent stake in eWing, a Japanese online brokerage firm, for an undisclosed amount, in a move to enter Japan's fast-growing online investing market.
HANOVER COMPRESSOR CO., Houston, which compresses natural gas to make it easier to ship and store, agreed to buy the rival OEC Compression Corp., Dallas, for about $29 million in stock.
